DAC to DAC crosstalk is the glitch impulse transferred to the output
of one DAC due to a digital code change and subsequent analog
output change of another DAC. DAC to DAC crosstalk is measured
with a full-scale code change (all 0s to all 1s and vice versa) on
one DAC output, using the write and update commands, while
monitoring the other DAC output kept at midscale. The energy of
the glitch is expressed in nV-sec.

DAC至DAC串擾是轉移到輸出的毛刺脈衝
一個DAC由於數字代碼變化和隨後的模擬
另一種DAC的輸出變化。測量DAC至DAC串擾
具有全規模的代碼（所有0s到所有1s，反之亦然）
一個DAC輸出，使用WRITE和UPDATE命令，同時
監控保存在MIDSCale的其他DAC輸出。能量的
故障在NV-SEC中表示。

clocked in. The following rising edge of CS/LD completes the SPI
transaction and executes the command. Figure 43 shows a typical
32-bit write command sequence with echo readback. For all write
commands, the command word reappears on the SDO pin with a
latency of one command cycle (echo readback). This latency allows
the user to read back the command from the device and verify
the integrity of the data transfer. Figure 44 shows a typical 32-bit
read command sequence. In this example, the user reads the fault
register. Both the read command and the requested data appear
with a latency of one command cycle during the transmission of the
next command word.

CS / LD的以下上升沿時鐘完成了SPI
事務並執行命令。圖43顯示了典型的
具有迴聲回讀的32位寫命令序列。適合所有寫作
命令，命令詞在SDO引腳上重新出現
一個命令周期的延遲（迴聲回讀）。此延遲允許
用戶從設備讀回命令並驗證
數據傳輸的完整性。圖44顯示了典型的32位
讀命令序列。在此示例中，用戶讀取故障
登記。讀取命令和請求的數據都顯示在內
在傳輸過程中具有一個命令周期的延遲
下一個命令字。

Figure 45 shows a typical 24-bit read command sequence. A 24‑bit
read command differs from a 32-bit read command in that only
the requested data appears with a latency of one command cycle
during the transmission of the next command word. The first eight
bits do not show the read command that was executed. Instead,
ignore those bits. Note that echo readback is not available when
24-bit command words are used.

圖45顯示了典型的24位讀命令序列。一個24位
讀命令與僅32位讀取命令不同
請求的數據顯示為一個命令周期的延遲
在下一個命令字的傳輸過程中。前八
位不顯示執行的讀命令。反而，
忽略這些比特。請注意，返回返回時不可用
使用24位命令單詞。

A[3:0], see Table 8. The optional CRC error checking is available

即使CRC錯誤檢查功能也是如此，也會跳過錯誤檢查
啟用。

I’ll take this moment to introduce the development lead for App Extensions, Jitendra Jagasia, as well as the development manager for App Extensions, Sunil D’Souza. I am the technologist for this feature�
我將花點時間介紹應用程序擴展名的開發潛在客戶Jitendra Jagasia，以及應用程序擴展的開發經理Sunil D’Souza。我是此功能的技術專家
for App Extensions, Jitendra Jagasia, as well as the
對於應用程序擴展，Jitendra Jagasia以及

I’ll take this moment to introduce the development lead for App Extensions, Jitendra Jagasia, as well as the development manager for App Extensions, Sunil D’Souza. I am the technologist for this feature.
Overall, I think we’re overindexing on “flatpak” and should re-focus on “app extensions”. Flatpak is an implementation detail of what we are transitioning to. The overall concept of iDRAC App Extensions accomplishes most of what you discuss below. The arc to understand here is that we started out with a very locked down implementation that we deliberately put strong controls on, and we are transitioning to a model that gives more flexibility, power and control to app extensions. What I see discussed so far can likely be done in our existing framework, and anything that doesn’t work we can change our framework to enable in future releases. I answer in detail your questions below, but keep in mind that several of the answers are basically irrelevant implementation details.

我將花點時間介紹應用程序擴展名的開發潛在客戶Jitendra Jagasia，以及應用程序擴展的開發經理Sunil D’Souza。我是此功能的技術專家。
總體而言，我認為我們對“ Flatpak”的索引過度，並且應該重新放在“應用擴展”上。 Flatpak是我們過渡到的實現細節。 IDRAC應用程序擴展的整體概念完成了您下面討論的大部分內容。這裡要理解的弧線是，我們從一個非常鎖定的實現開始，我們故意對其進行了強大的控制，並且我們正在過渡到一個模型，該模型可以為應用程序擴展提供更大的靈活性，功能和控制。到目前為止，我看到的討論可能可以在我們現有的框架中完成，並且任何行之有效的事情我們都可以更改我們的框架以在將來的版本中啟用。我在下面詳細回答您的問題，但請記住，幾個答案基本上是無關緊要的實施細節。

I’ll take this moment to introduce the development lead for App Extensions, Jitendra Jagasia, as well as the development manager for App Extensions, Sunil D’Souza. I am the technologist for this feature.�
我將花點時間介紹應用程序擴展名的開發潛在客戶Jitendra Jagasia，以及應用程序擴展的開發經理Sunil D’Souza。我是此功能的技術專家。
The arc to understand here is that we started out with a very locked down implementation that we deliberately put strong controls on, and we are transitioning to a model that gives more flexibility,
這裡要理解的弧線是，我們從一個非常鎖定的實現開始，我們故意對此進行了強大的控制，並且我們正在過渡到一個賦予更高靈活性的模型

What I see discussed so far can likely be done in our existing framework, and anything that doesn’t work we can change our framework to enable in future releases. I answer in detail your questions below, but keep in mind that several of the answers are basically irrelevant implementation details.
到目前為止，我看到的討論可能可以在我們現有的框架中完成，並且任何行之有效的事情我們都可以更改我們的框架以在將來的版本中啟用。我在下面詳細回答您的問題，但請記住，幾個答案基本上是無關緊要的實施細節。

The arc to understand here is that we started out with a very locked down implementation that we deliberately put strong controls on, and we are transitioning to a model that gives more flexibility, power and control to app extensions
在這裡要了解的弧線是，我們從一個非常鎖定的實現開始，我們故意對其進行了強大的控制，並且我們正在過渡到一個模型，該模型為應用程序擴展提供了更大的靈活性，力量和控制

1.	So “flatpak” itself is built mainly for desktop-style GUI applications. It’s certainly not appropriate for embedded applications requiring privileged operation and starting via systemd services. We have done a lot of work to patch up these and come up with some alternatives. As I mentioned, flatpak is a build tool, deployment tool, runtime tool.�
1.因此，“ Flatpak”本身主要用於台式GUI應用。當然，對於需要特權操作並通過SystemD服務開始的嵌入式應用程序不適。我們已經做了很多工作來修補這些問題，並提出了一些替代方案。正如我提到的，Flatpak是一種構建工具，部署工具，運行時工具。

2.	No. App Extensions are supported without licensing. We have discussed various ways to let an app extension tie into licensing to allow a way to monetize apps, but that work would need further discussion/design and implementation.�
2.否。無需許可，支持應用程序擴展名。我們已經討論了各種方法，使應用程序擴展名與許可融入許可，以允許將應用程序獲利的方法，但是這項工作需要進一步的討論/設計和實施。

能力

名詞:
    本領 (ability, capability, skill)
    能 (ability, capability, energy)
    能力 (ability, capability)
    能量 (capability, energy)
    能耐 (ability, capability, skill)
    性能 (capability, function, performance, property)

3.	16G App Extensions use “systemd-nspawn” to create fully containerized/firewalled and secure application environment for running apps. We lock down IPC/network/etc, and the application basically runs in an isolated chroot, with access to a very small, defined DBus API. For 17G, we retain that exact same mechanism, and are planning on how to extend it for our subsequent releases. What we are doing for the next 17G release would be to add the capability to run flatpak apps from App Extensions, which opens up things a lot.�

3. 16G應用程序擴展名使用“ Systemd-nspawn”來創建用於運行應用程序的完全容器化/防火牆和安全的應用程序環境。我們鎖定IPC/Network/etc，該應用程序基本上以孤立的Chroot運行，並訪問了一個很小的定義DBU API。對於17G，我們保留了完全相同的機制，併計劃如何將其擴展到我們隨後的版本。我們為下一個17G版本所做的工作是添加功能，從應用程序擴展程序中運行FlatPak應用程序，這為事情打開了很多東西。

4.	Regarding item 3 in our discussion, do you suggest we should first acquire the Extensibility SDK and start preliminary experiments on 16G iDRAC? If you believe this approach is beneficial, could you kindly direct us to where we can download the Extensibility SDK?�
4.關於我們的討論中的項目3，您是否建議我們首先獲得可擴展性SDK並在16G IDRAC上開始初步實驗？如果您認為這種方法是有益的，您能否將我們定向到可以下載可擴展性SDK的位置？

5.	In our current VxRail implementation, we operate a daemon on the host (ESXi) to collect data through the Redfish API from iDRAC USB NIC, and then we provide several internal APIs for our applications in the VxRail managers (which runs as a VM on the host). We are exploring the idea of transferring some business logic, such as data parsing, event handling, or firmware updates, to the Flatpak within the iDRAC OS. Would this strategy be practical and feasible?�
5.在當前的VXRAIL實施中，我們在主機（ESXI）上操作一個守護程序，以通過IDRAC USB NIC的Redfish API收集數據，然後我們為VXRAIL經理中的應用程序提供了幾個內部API（該應用程序作為VM運行在主機上）。我們正在探索將某些業務邏輯（例如數據解析，事件處理或固件更新）轉移到IDRAC OS中的Flatpak的想法。這種策略會實用且可行嗎？
. Let’s set up a call to whiteboard.

6.	Additionally, if we can host our daemon within the Flatpak on iDRAC OS, is there a possibility of accessing certain data (like hardware inventory, firmware inventory) directly over the d-bus instead of using the Redfish API?�
6.此外，如果我們可以在IDRAC OS的Flatpak中託管守護程序，是否有可能直接在D-Bus上訪問某些數據（例如硬件庫存，固件庫存），而不是使用紅魚API？

meeting on February 20th (UTC+8), despite the time difference. We truly appreciate your willingness to accommodate this meeting outside of your regular working hours. The topics we are interested in discussing are:
儘管有時間差，但2月20日會議（UTC+8）。我們非常感謝您願意在正常工作時間之外舉行這次會議。我們感興趣的討論主題是：

    同意 (agree, approve, assent, concur, consent)
    贊成 (applaud, approve, commend, concur, smile on, smile upon)
